SEARCH
Package Simulator

Class RobotManager

java.lang.Object
Simulator.RobotManager
public class RobotManager extends Object
The RobotManager class manages a list of Robots and handles incoming delivery requests. It subscribes to each robot and sends them new delivery requests as they come in. It also keeps track of the status of each robot and reports this information to the SimulatorUI.
Version:
1.0.0 20/04/2023
Author:
Jude Adam

      public RobotManager(ArrayList<Robot> robots)
      Constructor for RobotManager.

  • Method Details

    • addSubscriber

      private void addSubscriber(Robot robot)
      Add a robot to the subscribers list.
      Parameters:
      robot - The robot to be added to the list.

    • removeSubscriber

      private void removeSubscriber(Robot robot)
      Remove a robot from the subscribers list.
      Parameters:
      robot - The robot to be removed from the list.

    • update

      public void update()
      Update the subscribers with the latest delivery requests. If a robot can reach a delivery request, it will be assigned to that robot. If no robot can reach the request, the request will be moved to the end of the queue.

    • notify

      public void notify(Robot sender, RobotPowerState event)
      Notifies the RobotManager of a change in a robot's power state. If a robot is in standby mode, it will be added to the subscribers list. If a robot is delivering, it will be removed from the subscribers list.
      Parameters:
      sender - The robot that sent the notification.
      event - The power state event that occurred.

    • addRequest

      public void addRequest(Point deliveryPoint)
      Adds a delivery request to the end of the queue.
      Parameters:
      deliveryPoint - The delivery point to be added to the queue.

    • getRequests

      public Queue<Point> getRequests()

    • getSubscribers

      public ArrayList<Robot> getSubscribers()
